Description: Rim and body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery lidless lekanis with part of handle and turn to foot; interior glazed with reserved band and added red band or disc near centre of bowl; top of rim reserved with three rows of black dots; outside edge and handle flange glazed; on exterior, black-figure decoration consisting of animals (lion reclining, to left and looking back; red on eye, neck, chest, stripe under belly and strokes on flank); at right, rear of bird or siren, to right, with red on body; incised splinter rosettes with red dots as filling ornament; below, two to three black bands with rays radiating from foot.
Producer name: Attributed to the Circle of: The Polos Painter
Bibliographic references: Beazley 1944 / Groups of Early Attic Black Figure (p. 55, no. 4)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 336-7, no. B398)
Venit 1984 / Early Attic Black Figure Vases in Egypt (p. 151, note 67, no. 14)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0775) (Phase 1)
